intro: Neocabreria, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Neocabreria is native to the Americas and is often found in wetlands and disturbed soils. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
